content: möbius capelet / cowl from bella358 designs i love these to wear as scarves or to wear as shoulder wraps that stay in place i made mine from gradient kits from mont tricot but you could use any mini balls or scraps or just do it in one solid colour because i have colour changes i kept the edge plain but i am experimenting with edging…and you should too this pattern uses the so-called linen stitch which is really just chain single_crochet pairs repeated ~40 long and ~10 tall 5mm hook fingering yarn about 530 yd pre-blocking gauge 20st is 4 i have used various yarn gauges and hook sizes to create the drape i am looking for i change the number of foundation stitches depending on what length of cowl is needed just a cowl or a convertible shoulder wrap / cowl feel free to experiment i have also not edged picot edged and little pearl edged depending on the yarn sometimes i think and edging adds to the cowl/wrap sometimes i don t again have fun with it this is a great way to use up scraps as you just linen stitch until there is no more yarn1 please enjoy this pattern and feel free to sell items you make but do not sell or give this pattern please link back to my ravelry pattern thank you page 1 of 2 möbius capelet / cowl from bella358 designs chain 210 join r1 ch1 single_crochet in each chain around do not join r2 twist 180 degrees and put first r2 single_crochet into bottom of r1first single_crochet put a stitch marker in this stitch - ch1 skip next single_crochet single_crochet into next single_crochet repeat until end - around r2 creates the möbius there is no end or beginning st now alternative foundation if you do not enjoy twisting the foundation chain instead - leave at least a 6 tail when starting the foundation chain r1 chain one more for height/turn stitch turn single_crochet back to beginning of foundation chain return to r2 twist before joining join and then begin linen stitch by *single_crochet chain skip single_crochet* use the tail from the beginning of the foundation chain to sew the bottom of the join the bottom of the single_crochet second alternative foundation r1 no foundation chain leave at least a 6 tail when starting the foundation row complete 210 fdsc return to r2 with all foundation approaches r3-end single_crochet in each chain space ch1 over each single_crochet continue r3 with each colour join as required when ending slipstitch final stitch i ch1 and slip_stitch into the next single_crochet weave in ends and wet block please enjoy this pattern and feel free to sell items you make but do not sell or give this pattern please link back to my ravelry pattern thank you page 2 of 2
